summary: The Fiscal Contingency Preparedness Act (HR 4642) mandates the Secretary of the Treasury, in collaboration with the Office of Management and Budget, to assess the federal government's preparedness for fiscal shocks. This includes analyzing the fiscal risks and impacts of responses to events like economic recessions, natural disasters, health crises, and financial crises. The bill also requires the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to review and report on the methodology and results of the Treasury's fiscal analysis.
